Html:
After spending a significant time with Rawr (Bear), and evaluating various gear choices, it seems to me that the current model is very much in love with expertise up to the parry cap at the expense of other stats...

It's always nice when Rawr agrees with my gut feel, but this doesn't feel quite right, and so i have a question :)

(and please let me thank everyone in advance for the education and the hard work you have put in on an excellent program)

is the current model counting parry-hasting by the boss? my guess is that expertise is being over-valued in the current model on the basis of being both a threat and mitigation stat.

I noticed when gemming that the Precise Cardinal Ruby was ranked above other gems for its impact on both mitigation and threat. I tested this by equipping items like the Frostbitten Fur Boots with 0 gems (Superior Agility enchant) and noting a base mitigation of 15,471.83. Adding 40 agility through gems gave a mitigation of 16,872.58 or 35.02/agi. Removing the agi gems and adding 40 expertise thru gems gave a mitigation of 16,281.03 or 34.66/exp.

if parry hasting exists, then expertise is a mitigation stat. If not, it should be purely a threat stat?

my understanding is that parry-hasting has been removed in most, if not all, boss fights (even in ICC) - as seen below - and should therefore be a threat only stat (i'm perfectly willing to be wrong here :) ) :

There's an option on the Options tab, to choose whether the boss parry hastes or not. If checked, then Expertise appropriately reduces the damage you take by preventing parry hastes. Also, your logs don't show anything one way or another about parry haste; the boss gains parry haste after he parries one of your attacks, not after he gets parried.

found the option, thank you :)

and about the log...

/blush (mumbles indistinctly - just bought this account on ebay... noob... apologies)

these may be better? also, why the 10k armor default for bosses? i remember hearing about 13,083 for maexxna from beast lore and hadn't heard a lot since... i'm guessing you have access to a link i don't know about.

Again, thank you for the response and time. best regards.

"my understanding is that parry-hasting has been removed in most, if not all, boss fights (even in ICC) - as seen below - and should therefore be a threat only stat"

Parry-hasting is often removed from two kinds of fights: the first, where melee hits are strong enough individually to kill a tank in two hits, and two hits within X.X seconds is unintended; and the second, where multiple targets stand in front of the tank on purpose.  Saurfang has the potential to be in the first category (and due to strategy, is often in the second); Marrowgar is firmly in the second because of his saber lash mechanic.  

While parry haste may not be relevant on those two bosses, that doesn't mean it's removed from the game.

thank you for the insights!

i'll make sure and keep an eye out :)
The default armor is 10643, because that's how much armor all known WotLK bosses have. There's virtually no reason to change that, as a user, but it's left there if you want to mess with things.

ah good to know... i was going off very old stuff:

http://elitistjerks.com/f15/t37584-wrath_boss_armor_testing/

and hadn't seen that it had changed.

hehe... probly need to l2 do my own testing, but they had included the target dummies :)
